vague_description: The strata-management company needs to balance aesthetics, power needs, and electricity constraints to determine the optimal combination of two air conditioner types.
detailed_description: A strata-management company is looking into purchasing two types of air conditioners, a low-power and a high-power model. A low-powered air conditioner can cool down \param{LowPowerCapacity} housing units and uses \param{LowPowerElectricity} units of electricity every day. A high-power model can cool down \param{HighPowerCapacity} housing units and uses \param{HighPowerElectricity} units of electricity every day. Since the low-powered model is not good for the aesthetics, the strata decided to limit the number of low-powered models to only \param{MaxLowPowerProportion} and at least \param{MinHighPower} high-powered models must be used. If the apartment needs to condition at least \param{MinHousingUnits} housing units and has \param{TotalElectricity} units of electricity available, how many of each air conditioner should the strata company buy to minimize the total number of air conditioners?
target_objective: Minimize the total number of air conditioners purchased
target_constraints: Number of low-power air conditioners is non-negative
Number of high-power air conditioners is non-negative
Number of low-power air conditioners limited to MaxLowPowerProportion of the total air conditioners
At least MinHighPower high-powered air conditioners must be used
Need to condition at least MinHousingUnits housing units
Available electricity not to exceed TotalElectricity units
target_parameters: Cooling capacity of a low-powered air conditioner
Electricity usage of a low-powered air conditioner per day
Cooling capacity of a high-powered air conditioner
Electricity usage of a high-powered air conditioner per day
Maximum proportion of low-powered air conditioners
Minimum number of high-powered air conditioners required
Minimum number of housing units to condition
